learning_outcomes.description: Understand medical terminology and abbreviations associated with selected medical conditions and common lifestyle diseases.
Demonstrate a thorough knowledge, interpretation and application of medical nutrition therapy as an intervention in selected chronic and acute medical conditions.

Collect, analyse and interpret relevant health, medical, cultural, social, psychological, economic, personal, environmental dietary intake and food supply data in determining the health and nutritional status of individuals.
Apply the Nutrition Care Process in a client-centred manner to develop nutrition care plans.
Acknowledge the multiple factors that influence nutrition and health and apply this to practice.
Critically appraise and translate scientific knowledge and principles related to nutrition into practical information for health professionals, clients and the general public.
Work effectively within a dietetic student team in order to develop communication and process management skills, and facilitate peer-assisted, collaborative learning.

assessments.task_description:
This assessment focuses on the development of your professional identity as a future health practitioner and helps you build your critical reflective practice skills.

Further information will be available on Blackboard.
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be submitted via the relevant ePortfolio submission link via the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Case Study Assessment - Nutrition Care Process
assessments.category: Paper/ Report/ Annotation, Practical/ Demonstration, Translation/ Interpretation
assessments.task_description:
The purpose of this assessment is to provide you with an opportunity to apply your nutrition knowledge and skills to the Nutrition Care Process.

The task will assess your skills in gathering relevant information as part of a nutrition assessment, and your ability to make appropriate nutrition diagnoses and prioritise goals.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description: This task enables you to track your progress in clinic. You will be required to demonstrate your developing skills such as working collaboratively within a dietetics team and application of medical nutrition therapy theory, as well as support your growth as a future dietitian committed to lifelong learning and improvement.

learning_activities.topic:
Interprofessional Simulation Session

Each student will be allocated and attend one Interprofessional Simulation Session during the semester. These sessions will occur on Tuesday afternoons.
learning_activities.topic_description: Interprofessional Simulation Session Each student will be allocated and attend one Interprofessional Simulation Session during the semester. These sessions will occur on Tuesday afternoons.

learning_activities.topic:
Clinic placement days

Each student will be allocated and attend 5 clinic days across the semester. These will be on either a Monday and/or Friday from Week 4 to Week 13.
learning_activities.topic_description: Clinic placement days Each student will be allocated and attend 5 clinic days across the semester. These will be on either a Monday and/or Friday from Week 4 to Week 13.
